cities.name: Baku

interests.name: Icherisheher (Old City)
interests.description: UNESCO-listed historic core of Baku with medieval walls, narrow alleys, mosques, caravanserais, and traditional houses.

interests.name: Maiden Tower
interests.description: Mysterious 12th-century tower and symbol of Baku, offering views over the Old City and Caspian Sea.

interests.name: Palace of the Shirvanshahs
interests.description: 15th-century palace complex representing the peak of Shirvan-Absheron architecture.

interests.name: Baku Boulevard (Seaside Promenade)
interests.description: Long waterfront promenade along the Caspian Sea with parks, caf√©s, and leisure areas.

interests.name: Flame Towers
interests.description: Iconic modern skyscrapers symbolizing contemporary Baku, illuminated dramatically at night.

cities.local_food_tip: Try Azerbaijani classics like plov (rice pilaf), dolma, kebabs, qutab flatbreads, and black tea with jam. Old City restaurants are ideal for traditional cuisine.

full_day.Morning: Start in Icherisheher ‚òÄÔ∏è, exploring stone streets, the Maiden Tower, and the Shirvanshahs‚Äô Palace üèõÔ∏è.
full_day.Afternoon: Walk down to Baku Boulevard üåä for lunch and a seaside stroll.
full_day.Sunset: Head up toward the Flame Towers üåÖ for city views as lights begin to glow.
full_day.Night: Dinner in the Old City üçΩÔ∏è or along the boulevard, followed by a night walk with illuminated landmarks.

spring.description: Celebration of the Persian New Year with music, bonfires, and cultural traditions.

ideas.name: Boulevard walks
ideas.description: Mild weather and fresh sea air.

summer.description: Hot days balanced by breezes from the sea and active nightlife.

autumn.description: Pleasant weather and a busy calendar of exhibitions and performances.

winter.description: Cool, windy weather with fewer tourists and a calmer city rhythm.

public_transport_tips.tip: Baku Metro is fast, affordable, and connects major areas of the city.
Buses and taxis are widely available for shorter trips.
The Old City and Boulevard areas are best explored on foot.

city_events.name: Novruz Bayram Celebrations
city_events.description: Traditional New Year festivities with music, dance, and cultural rituals.

places.name: Azerbaijan Carpet Museum
places.description: Unique museum dedicated to Azerbaijani carpet weaving, housed in a rolled-carpet-shaped building.

places.name: Heydar Aliyev Center
places.description: Futuristic cultural center designed by Zaha Hadid, showcasing exhibitions and national history.

hidden_gems.name: Quiet courtyards of Icherisheher
hidden_gems.description: Hidden residential corners away from tourist routes.

hidden_gems.name: Early-morning Boulevard
hidden_gems.description: Peaceful seaside atmosphere before the city wakes.

cities.name: Ganja

interests.name: Imamzadeh Complex
interests.description: Important religious complex and mausoleum with blue-tiled dome, one of Azerbaijan‚Äôs most sacred sites.

interests.name: Nizami Mausoleum
interests.description: Monument dedicated to the great poet Nizami Ganjavi, set in landscaped gardens on the outskirts of the city.

interests.name: Javad Khan Street
interests.description: Central pedestrian boulevard lined with caf√©s, shops, fountains, and local life.

interests.name: Shah Abbas Mosque
interests.description: 17th-century mosque in the historic center, reflecting classical Safavid architecture.

interests.name: Bottle House (Shebeke House)
interests.description: Unique private house decorated with thousands of glass bottles and mirrors, symbol of local creativity.

cities.local_food_tip: Ganja cuisine is known for plov variations, dolma, kebabs, and sweets. Local tea with jams is an essential part of hospitality.

full_day.Morning: Start at Javad Khan Street ‚òÄÔ∏è for breakfast and a relaxed walk, then visit the nearby Shah Abbas Mosque üïå.
full_day.Afternoon: Head to the Nizami Mausoleum üèõÔ∏è and gardens, followed by a stop at the Bottle House üè†.
full_day.Sunset: Visit the Imamzadeh Complex üåÖ as evening light reflects off the blue tiles.
full_day.Night: Dinner along Javad Khan Street üçΩÔ∏è and an evening stroll among fountains and caf√©s.

spring.description: Persian New Year celebrated with music, sweets, and cultural traditions across the city.

summer.description: Hot days balanced by lively evenings in pedestrian areas.

autumn.description: Pleasant temperatures and cultural activities around poetry and history.

winter.description: Cool weather with fewer tourists and a slower pace.

public_transport_tips.tip: Ganja has a domestic airport with flights to Baku and other cities.
Trains and buses connect Ganja with Baku and western Azerbaijan.
The city center is walkable; taxis are affordable.

city_events.name: Nizami Ganjavi Days
city_events.description: Cultural events honoring the city‚Äôs famous poet.

places.name: Heydar Aliyev Park (Ganja)
places.description: Large landscaped park for walks and family time.

places.name: Ganja State Philharmonic Hall
places.description: Cultural venue hosting concerts and performances.

hidden_gems.name: Quiet side streets near Javad Khan
hidden_gems.description: Local neighborhoods with authentic daily life.

cities.name: Lankaran

interests.name: Lankaran Fortress (Zindan Tower)
interests.description: Historic fortress remains and prison tower from the 18th century, symbol of Lankaran‚Äôs past under various empires.

interests.name: Khanbulan Lake
interests.description: Scenic artificial lake surrounded by forests, popular for picnics, fresh air, and short nature escapes.

interests.name: Lankaran Lighthouse
interests.description: Historic lighthouse near the Caspian Sea, closely connected to the old fortress area.

interests.name: Hirkan National Park (access area)
interests.description: UNESCO-listed subtropical forest zone with rare plant species, hiking paths, and rich biodiversity.

interests.name: Lankaran City Beach (Caspian Sea)
interests.description: Caspian Sea coastline used by locals for evening walks and summer relaxation.

cities.local_food_tip: Lankaran is famous for citrus fruits, tea, fish dishes, and lavangi (stuffed fish or chicken with walnuts and herbs). Tea culture here is especially strong.

full_day.Morning: Start at the Lankaran Fortress ‚òÄÔ∏è and nearby Lighthouse, learning about the city‚Äôs history.
full_day.Afternoon: Head inland toward Khanbulan Lake üåø for lunch and nature time, or visit tea houses in the city.
full_day.Sunset: Walk along the Caspian Sea coast üåÖ as the light softens over the water.
full_day.Night: Dinner with local lavangi dishes üçΩÔ∏è followed by traditional tea served with citrus jam.

spring.description: Spring arrives early in Lankaran, with green landscapes and citrus blossoms.

ideas.name: Tea plantations visits
ideas.description: See how local tea is grown.

summer.description: Warm, humid climate with active coastal and evening life.

ideas.name: Beach relaxation
ideas.description: Cooling off by the Caspian Sea.

autumn.description: Orange and lemon harvests define autumn in Lankaran.

winter.description: One of Azerbaijan‚Äôs warmest regions in winter, calm and green.

public_transport_tips.tip: Buses and minibuses connect Lankaran with Baku and southern regions.
Lankaran International Airport offers limited domestic flights.
Taxis are the easiest way to reach lakes and forests outside the city.

city_events.name: Citrus & Tea Festivals
city_events.description: Local celebrations highlighting Lankaran‚Äôs agricultural heritage.

places.name: Lankaran Central Market
places.description: Bustling market with citrus fruits, tea, fish, and local produce.

places.name: Heydar Aliyev Park (Lankaran)
places.description: Urban green park used by locals for evening walks.

hidden_gems.name: Quiet tea plantations outside the city
hidden_gems.description: Peaceful rural landscapes and authentic tea culture.

hidden_gems.name: Early-morning Caspian coast
hidden_gems.description: Calm sea views before the city becomes active.

cities.name: Mingachevir

interests.name: Mingachevir Reservoir
interests.description: The largest reservoir in Azerbaijan, often called the ‚Äòsea of Mingachevir‚Äô, used for recreation, fishing, and scenic walks.

interests.name: Mingachevir Dam
interests.description: Massive hydroelectric dam on the Kura River, a key part of Azerbaijan‚Äôs energy and irrigation system.

interests.name: Kura River Promenade
interests.description: Riverside area popular for evening walks, fishing spots, and relaxed local life.

interests.name: Mingachevir State Drama Theater
interests.description: Cultural venue hosting plays, performances, and local artistic events.

interests.name: Archaeological Museum of Mingachevir
interests.description: Museum displaying artifacts from ancient settlements discovered around the Kura River valley.

cities.local_food_tip: Local caf√©s focus on simple Azerbaijani cuisine: kebabs, plov, fresh fish from the reservoir, and black tea served throughout the day.

full_day.Morning: Start with a walk along the Kura River Promenade ‚òÄÔ∏è, enjoying calm water views and local fishermen.
full_day.Afternoon: Visit the Archaeological Museum üè∫, then head toward the Mingachevir Reservoir üåä for lunch and fresh air.
full_day.Sunset: Stop near the Mingachevir Dam üåÖ to watch the light fade over the water.
full_day.Night: Dinner in town üçΩÔ∏è followed by a quiet evening walk or a performance at the Drama Theater.

spring.description: Mild weather and greenery make the riverbanks especially pleasant.

summer.description: Hot days with cooling breezes near the water; city life shifts outdoors in the evenings.

autumn.description: Cooler air and softer light around the reservoir and river.

winter.description: Cool temperatures with a slower city rhythm and fewer visitors.

public_transport_tips.tip: Buses and trains connect Mingachevir with Baku and central Azerbaijan.
The city is compact; taxis are affordable and widely used.
Walking is ideal for riverside and central areas.

city_events.name: Mingachevir City Day
city_events.description: Local celebrations with concerts and community events.

places.name: Heydar Aliyev Park (Mingachevir)
places.description: Urban park popular for family walks and relaxation.

places.name: Central Square of Mingachevir
places.description: Main public square surrounded by shops and caf√©s.

hidden_gems.name: Quiet reservoir shores
hidden_gems.description: Less-visited spots with open water views.

hidden_gems.name: Early-morning Kura River banks
hidden_gems.description: Peaceful atmosphere before the city becomes active.

cities.name: Sheki

interests.name: Sheki Khan‚Äôs Palace
interests.description: UNESCO-listed 18th-century palace famous for its colorful shebeke stained-glass windows and frescoes.

interests.name: Sheki Historic Center
interests.description: Traditional neighborhood with stone houses, caravanserais, mosques, and craft workshops.

interests.name: Upper and Lower Caravanserai
interests.description: Well-preserved caravanserais once used by Silk Road traders, now cultural sites and guesthouses.

interests.name: Church of Kish
interests.description: Ancient church in nearby Kish village, associated with early Caucasian Albanian Christianity.

interests.name: Sheki Bazaar
interests.description: Local market offering fresh produce, spices, sweets, and everyday life scenes.

cities.local_food_tip: Sheki is famous for piti (slow-cooked lamb stew served in clay pots), Sheki halva, fresh bread, and local honey‚Äîmust-try regional specialties.

full_day.Morning: Begin at the Sheki Khan‚Äôs Palace ‚òÄÔ∏è, then stroll through the historic center with its stone streets.
full_day.Afternoon: Visit the caravanserais üèõÔ∏è, have lunch with traditional piti üç≤, and browse the Sheki Bazaar.
full_day.Sunset: Take a short trip to the Church of Kish üåÑ for views and history.
full_day.Night: Dinner in town üçΩÔ∏è and an evening walk through the softly lit old streets.

spring.description: Spring celebrations with music, traditions, and green mountain scenery.

summer.description: Warm days with cooler evenings due to mountain air.

autumn.description: Cooler weather, golden colors, and a relaxed pace.

winter.description: Cool temperatures and calm streets with light snowfall.

public_transport_tips.tip: Buses connect Sheki with Baku and other regional cities.
Taxis are the easiest way to reach Kish village.
The historic center is compact and walkable.

city_events.name: Sheki Silk Road Festival
city_events.description: Cultural festival celebrating Sheki‚Äôs Silk Road heritage.

places.name: Sheki City Museum
places.description: Museum covering local history and crafts.

places.name: Upper Mosque
places.description: Historic mosque serving the old town community.

hidden_gems.name: Quiet courtyards near caravanserais
hidden_gems.description: Hidden corners showing traditional daily life.
